text: Perry County is a county in the U.S. state of Kentucky. As of the 2020 census, the population was 28,473. Its county seat is Hazard. The county was formed in 1820. Both the county and county seat are named for Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry, a naval hero in the War of 1812. == References == Category:1820 establishments in Kentucky Category:Kentucky counties
title: Perry County, Kentucky
